post.summary: ListActiveApps Get the active apps to lookup data for
ListActiveAppsMetadata gets the app id, account id, and edition id for each of the apps an account has active.
Get the config for a partner or market
Get a summary of highlights for a report
Save the config for a partner or market
List data for a report category.
List all dates (weekly/monthly) for a time period

ReportDataFormat.title: The accepted formats for a value

ReportDataTemplateType.description:
- NOT_SPECIFIED: Results in an error when creating report data (to avoid defaulting to number_with_change)
 - NUMBER_WITH_CHANGE: A template type to display a number value with an optional change value.
 - CALL_TO_ACTION: A template type to display a call to action for a marketplace app
 - BASIC_LIST: A basic list has a header, body and footer for each element in the list. A header or body is the minimum requirement,
 - INFO_LIST: An info list has the same as the BASIC_LIST, plus info text, color, and icon to be displayed in the top right-most column of the template;
as well as an icon url for the left-most column of the template
 - BAR_CHART: A template type to display horizontal bar graphs with a specified fill percentage, a label on the left side, and a value on the right. The
fill percentage and label are the minimum requirement.
 - BASIC_NUMBER: A number template to display just a number with a title and description.
 - THERMOMETER_WITH_GRADE: A template type to display the letter grade and the specific score with change. Also a thermometer graph is shown that can display
multiple data points (starting score, industry average and 95th percentile) for comparison reasons, the graph is split up into
5 sections depending on the percentile scores representing the grade values A, B, C, D and F
 - LINE_GRAPH: A template type to display a line graph of progress over time.
 - WORD_CLOUD: A template type for word cloud
ReportDataTemplateType.title: Executive Report template types

ReportDataWidth.description: How much space (width) a template card will take up.

label.title: The label on the left of the bar

value.title: The value displayed on the right of the bar

fillPercent.title: The percentage of the bar that will be filled with color

v1BarChart.title: An item in a bar chart

v1Category.description: LMI categories to push data to for the Executive Report. Categories have their own heading in the report.

v1Color.title: Available colors to choose from for certain fields, eg right_info_text_color in an INFO_LIST template

partnerId.title: partner ID of the partner to save the config for

marketId.title: market ID of the market to save the config for

v1GetReportConfigRequest.title: Request to get report config for a partner/market

v1GetReportConfigResponse.title: Response to get report config for a partner/market

frequency.title: The frequency of the report, e.g. monthly or weekly

accountGroupId.description: The unique identifier of the account group.

reportDate.title:
A date equal to the first day of the month if frequency is MONTHLY
or last day of the week (Sunday) if frequency is WEEKLY
ie: MONTHLY would be: 2017-04-01.
WEEKLY would be 2017-04-23 (the Sunday)

v1GraphMarker.title: GraphMarker to highlight a significant value on a graph

The optional translations for this item's highlight field.
Maps IETF Language Tags to the translated highlight item string
Ex: 'en-US': 'Hello World!', 'cs-CZ': 'Ahoj svÄ›te!'
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag

size of the page to list

A date equal to the first day of the month if frequency is MONTHLY
or last day of the week (Sunday) if frequency is WEEKLY
ie: MONTHLY would be: 2017-04-01.
WEEKLY would be 2017-04-23 (the Sunday)

How much the value has changed from the last report, A negative value is a decrease in the performance of
the stat (bad), and a positive value is an increase in the performance (good).

The frequency type of a report (types for whether the report is a weekly or monthly report)
